text: Bottle from the rotbox. Moderately strong vanilla and wood. Pleasant booze. Light pepper. Taste is hugely paper oxidation. Watery. Not pleasant. Oxidation kills this in a major bad way.

750ml bottle, thanks Harri. Pours hazy dark caramely reddish colour, small beige head stays as ring. Prunes, vanilla, raisins, malts, sharp bourbon in aroma. Taste is sweet, caramely, salty, mildly smoky, boozy, bourbon. Whiskey and booze in aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, soft carbo. Warming brew for cold winter night, bit too much alcoholy taste.

750ml bottle (thanks Harri). Clear dark chestnu color. Tiny to almost no head. Alcohol, caramel, sweet, raisins, plums, vanilla, cognac, blooms in aroma. Almonds, caramel, raisins, plums, alcohol, sweetish in taste. Quite boozy and sweetish and woody in aftertaste. Boozy and sweet. Im surprised that I like it.

Bottle. Pours brown with small head, Aroma: butterscotch, caramel, toffee, bourbon, nice sweet aroma. Taste: medium plus sweet, tofee, milk coffee, weak caramel, butterscotch, Full body. Sweet finish.

Bottle 750ml. @ [ Klimaet Cellar Clearance Tasting ], Aarhus, Denmark. [ As The Bruery Chronology: 6 Wee Heavy ].Unclear medium orange yellow colour with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, sweet malt, caramel, dried fruit. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, sweet malt, bourbon, coconut, vanilla, dried fruity, caramel, light wood. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20170203]
 8-3-8-3-16

Bottle @ "Klimaet Cellar Clearance", 13,7%. Hazy dark amber/brown with small tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel, oak, wood, toasted and coconut. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, coconut, sweet, oak, wood, warming, bourbon, vanilla and a little bitter.

Klimaet cellar clearance. Pours hazy dark reddish brown with an offwhite head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, wood, vanilla, rich bourbon. Flavor is sweet, malty, caramel, bread, rich bourbon, wood, alcohol. Medium to full body, average carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 030217

Bottle @ Klimaet Cellar Clearance. Hazy deep orange red with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit and bourbon. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with lots of warming alcohol. Oily. 030217
Bottle. Pours hazy reddish brown with a small brown head. Aromas of vanilla, bourbon, toffee, butterscotch, milk chocolate, dark fruits. Taste is sweet, malty, caramel, fudge, vanilla.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, malt, hops and has a nice fruity finish.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Bottle. Aroma of caramel, light oak and smoke, some booze, bourbon, caramel. Hazy reddish brown with off-white head, not lasting. Taste is moderate sweet, light+ bitter, alcohol. Full body, oily feel, sweet caramel finish.

750ml bottle during a bottle sharing @Pulapka, Gdansk
A lot of bourbon on the nose, toffie, some raisins and vanilla. Very intensive beer, taste has lots of bourbon notes to in. Nice vanilla finish

Nice lookin chestnut colored beer with good head. 
Nose is sweet as is the flavor. Dark fruit and toffee up front, with some vanilla and booze and wood. Abv shows, but not overly. Nice sipper if a little overly sweet.

Bottle. Poured a hazy dark brown color with a moderate frothy brown head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Medium to heavy toasted malt, wood and earthy scotch aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bourbon complex sweet flavor with a medium to heavy bourbon sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Standout complex brew.

750 ml bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a hazy caramel brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, caramel, wood, dark fruits, toffee, light nutty character, bourbon, vanilla, I like the drinkability of this even with the abv.

Bottle thanks to Wickedestman. Taste of sticky toffee pudding, dried fruits, whisky, brown sugar, vanilla and alcohol.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle. Poured a deep amber, near brown color with an off white head. Caramel, toffee, bourbon, vanilla, wood, and some dark fruits. I had no problem finishing this one myself despite the near 14%.

August 13, 2016. Bottle at Bruery Bonanza 2016. 2016 edition. 

Slught murky amber/reddish with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet malty, toffee, sugary, bourbon, hints of oak, some raisins. Taste is sweet malty, soft bitter, slight boozy. Finish is sligjt sticky sweetness with caramel, dark sugars, some warming bourbon, notes if figs and vanilla. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation.
A: Brown/red coloured with a thin off white head. N: Figs, dates, vanilla, bourbon T: Vanilla, caramel, figs O: Very nice and complex flavours!

Pours a pretty nut brown colour with no head. Noses hugely borbonny. Taste is also wildly barrel forward. Light scotch ale in the background. Toffee and light coffee.. Mouthfeel is fairly light and drinkable for the big bold flavours. Almost like a light scotch ale with a shot of cheap bourbon poured into it.. I dont hate it, but this is a bit too one dimensional for my personal preference.
750ml bottle pours a brown color with a bit of head. Harp bourbon flavor that smooths a little with some time to breathe. Lots of malt and some of the spice.

Aroma: heavily bourbon, boozy; Appearance: hazy, dark amber pour with thin white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: definitely a scotch ale aged in bourbon barrels; nice combination but a little too sweet; would like a little more malt; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: very enjoyable but very strong. Would get again.
Bottle at Liquid Sunshine. Cloudy, yeasty brown. Soap. big toffee sweet, syrup. Toffee pudding. Robust, heavy, super sweet. Simple syrup. Nice.

(En fût à la brasserie): Je comprend difficilement les critiques précédentes. Le nez est extraordinaire, du caramel fondant et des abricôts dans un enrobage bourbon incroyablement réconfortant. La finale sévapore tranquillement et on a rapidement envi de récidiver. Une perle.

Bottle at Liquid On tap at the source in Seattle-USA. Bottle. Cloudy amber, little off white foam. Nose: rich barley wine notes, passito wine. Mouth: sweet vanilla, molasses, rich syrup. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Well talk about a waxed cap. This took forever to open. Clear darker amber, small head, minimal lace/retention. Aroma of strong oak barrel, booze, as well as caramel, various fruits - sweet orange, sugar, virtually no smoke. Full bodied, boozy with a big oak flavor - fruity orange-caramel flavors dominate. Pretty tasty.
Bottle..Pour is golden with a small white head..Nose is bourbon, spice, oak, caramel...Taste is sticky, bourbon, oak, spice, musty...

Type: 750-ml bottle (25.4 oz.
Glass: AleSmith Barrel-Aged Reserve snifter glass 
From: Beer Advocates heresy22
Price: N/A
Purchased: N/A; Received Feb. 22, 2016
Consumed: Feb. 26, 2016
Misc.: Bottled on Dec. 21, 2015 at 12:25 p.m. PT; Blue waxed cap on neck

Thanks, Chris!

To say I was excited about this would be the understatement of the century. Ever since I tried AleSmiths Barrel-Aged Wee Heavy, Ive been kind of obsessed with the style. Once Chris showed me that this was coming up from The Bruery in increments of six, 12 and 18 months, I instantly wanted to try all three. Cant wait to get this underway.

Poured an auburn, dark amber, murky color with two fingers of khaki tan, frothy head. Above average spotty lacing on the sides of the glass. Above average retention on the top all the way down. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled sticky caramel, toffee, boozy bourbon up front, but mellowed out, light tobacco, faint dates, some butterscotch (wishful?) and brown sugar. (Smell - 4.00)

Taste followed the nose. This definitely needs some more time, coming in a tad hot. Getting caramel, toffee, somewhat boozy bourbon, brown sugar, vanilla (didnt recognize this on the nose), hints of dried tobacco, some oaky wood and muted butterscotch. (Taste - 4.00)

Medium body. Creamy texture. Average-to-lively carbonation. Long, boozy, warming finish. (Feel - 4.00)

God I wanted this one to be better. I think it will be with time, but not quite there yet. Looking forward to comparing with the 12 and 18-month versions. (Overall - 4.00)

4.00 90 A-
Tap room - Sweet caramel and some spice.  Clearish Amber with a decent white head.  Sweet caramel, light barrel and more of that cinnamon spice.  Nice but a bit of interesting spice notes.
Cloudy brown with a minimal head. Aroma is caramel, dates, raisins, vanilla. Full bodied,
Tap at bruery. Deep brown murky color. Thin head. Boozy sweet toffee arona. Taste follows, thick lots of malty nuts and toffe.

21 Jan 2016, tap at the Bruery. Murky brown. Nose is very unusual. I cant place it. Spicy, funky (but not is a sour beer way), cedar is probably what it is. Med body and mildly fizzy. Wet cedar and toffee. Nice enough.
